oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SOLITARY-WAVE-INDUCED BOUNDARY LAYER FLOWS OVER PERMEABLE BEDS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pujara, Nimish
Meza-Valle, Claudio
Liu, Philip L.-F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the nearshore environment, viscous effects of wave- induced boundary layer flows above sea beds are important in evaluating sediment fluxes and wave damping. These effects need to be included in phase- resolved nearshore models for accurate determination of quantities such as the bed shear stress and the decrease in wave height due to frictional dissipation. In this work, we analyze the boundary layers induced by a solitary wave on permeable sea beds (extending previous work of wave-induced boundary layers on an impermeable bed). We find that the velocity profiles and bed shear stress are sensitive to the hydraulic conductivity of the bed, but not extremely sensitive to the precise boundary condition at the bed-fluid interface.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36v (2020): Proceedings of virtual Conference on Coastal Engineering, 2020; waves.9
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright (c) 2020 Nimish Pujara, Claudio Meza-Valle, Philip L.-F. Liu
